meta.name: viewport
meta.title: COVID-19 Update - Frankston Independent School District

meta.content: Frankston ISD remains in regular contact with local, state and federal health officials for the latest information and will continue to provide updates to the community as needed. At this location you will find information about Frankston ISD’s response and plans related to Coronavirus, including links to helpful information.

link.title: Frankston Elementary - News

form.name: aspnetForm

div.p: School will be closed through the remainder of the 2019 -2020 school year.

span.p: School will be closed through the remainder of the 2019 -2020 school year.

span.strong: Current information about Frankston ISD’s response and plans related to Coronavirus, including links to helpful information.

p.strong: Frankston ISD remains in regular contact with local, state and federal health officials for the latest information and will continue to provide updates to the Community as needed. The following communications have been shared with the district community:

p.br: Govenor Abbott issues Executive Order, all Texas schools will remain closed for the remainder of ther 2019-2020 school year. FISD will provide more information regarding end-of-year events, graduation, and student instruction as soon as possible.

As Texas schools continue to deal with the COVID-19 outbreak, it is important for Local Education Agencies (LEAs) to recognize students and families may be struggling with stress, anxiety, grief, and loss. Schools can support the mental health, wellness, and resiliency of students through trauma informed approaches. Below is a list of statewide resources that can help schools connect families with specific resources as needs are identified.

span.p: Though we are apart right now for our health and safety, we at FISD continue to support each other as a community, and right now we must work together to fight COVID-19. In order to help prevent the spread of COVID-19, FISD will be reaching out to you via email, phone, text message, and social media over the next two weeks to share vitally important guidance.

This guidance is based on what scientists know about how to prevent the spread of COVID-19, and it is our hope that you will do what you can to follow these practices and share them with your friends and family.

Thank you for all you are doing to educate your children at home and all the efforts you’re making to keep your family healthy and safe. We know this is a difficult time. If we stand apart as a community during this stretch and continue following the public health practices we will be sharing over the coming days, we will be back together soon.

ul.li: Gov. Abbott announced Tuesday, March 31 that Texas schools would be restricted to distance learning until at least May 4.
Frankston ISD outdoor facilities are now closed. This includes: track, tennis courts, ball fields, and playground.
FISD will continue to distribute meals to anyone ages 18 and under at designated locations during pick-up times.
Student assignment packets can be returned to the campus foyers 24 hours a day.
